intro: Gymnandra dentata, commonly known as the serrated gymnandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Gymnandra dentata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
